description.summary: An elegant and creamy mushroom risotto made with Arborio rice, white wine, and earthy mushrooms. This Italian classic is luxurious yet surprisingly easy to prepare.

preparation.step: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook until golden and their liquid is released, about 8-10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat.
Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add Arborio rice and stir constantly for 1-2 minutes to toast slightly.
Pour in white wine and stir until mostly absorbed.
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly. Wait until each addition is mostly absorbed before adding the next, about 18-20 minutes total.
When rice is creamy and tender, remove from heat and stir in remaining 2 tablespoons butter, Parmesan cheese, and cooked mushrooms.
Season to taste and serve immediately, garnished with fresh parsley.
